de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.client.core
Class GameEngineNetwork

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.client.core.GameEngineNetwork
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameEngine, ClientExecutables, de.root1.simon.SimonRemote, java.io.Serializable
public class GameEngineNetwork
extends java.util.Observable
implements GameEngine, ClientExecutables

The network game engine. A facade, which provides access to the minerva subsystems. These subsystems are placed on the server side and will be called via the ServerExecutables (serverEngine) interface. Note, that the engine implements the ClientExecutables interface, too. This interface provides methods, which are invokable by the server side.

Since:
1.0
Version:
$Id: ApplicationConfiguration.java 699 2010-07-04 17:07:33Z andre.koenig $
See Also:
ApplicationConfigurationManager, Serialized Form

addObserver

public void addObserver(java.util.Observer o)
Add an observer. The game engine is observable. So an observer object can, well, observe the engine and will be informed by some methods, that something has changed.

Specified by:
addObserver in interface GameEngine
Overrides:

Parameters:
The - remove candidate.

refreshPlayer

public void refreshPlayer(Player player)
Method, which can be invoked from the server side. The server calls this method and pushes the updated client player object. The engine will then inform all observers that an "change" occurred.

Specified by:
refreshPlayer in interface ClientExecutables
Parameters:
player - The 'fresh' player object.
